info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 6:40PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL DEARBORN, NORTHERN BOONE AND SOUTHWESTERN HAMILTON COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM EDT... At 640 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Hidden Valley, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Florence, Cheviot, Villa Hills, Lawrenceburg, Greendale, Bright, Burlington, Hidden Valley, Oakbrook, Cleves, Shawnee, Taylor Creek, Bridgetown, Delhi Township, Miami Heights, Monfort Heights, Mack, Delhi Hills and Delshire. This includes the following Interstates... I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 7 and 16. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 181 and 182. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for southeastern Indiana...northern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
